values: Author Kris Newby explains how the first Lyme Disease infections happened just a few miles from an animal-testing lab in Connecticut.  Could the spread of the disease be related to a lab leak?

In the late 1960â€™s, government bioweapons labs started injecting ticks with exotic diseases. Soon, people nearby began to get those diseases. Now, tick-borne Lyme is endemic. Naturally the government has admitted nothing.
